revised_title: Ovulation and Degeneration of Ova in the Rabbit: A Study on the Role of Copulation and Fertilization
tldr: This study investigates the ovulation and degeneration of ova in rabbits, finding that ovulation occurs 10 hours after copulation and is dependent on the presence of spermatozoa. The research also highlights the importance of copulation in inducing follicle rupture and the formation of the corpus luteum.
